result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean A. Maylin

records.addlTxt:
2:32 PM Defendant Sean A. Maylin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Sean A. Maylin.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dolch explains nonappearance by DE.   Court provides new court date provided by Br 3.  State agrees to reinstate the prior bond.  Court so orders previous bond and any of it's conditions reinstated.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:13 PM Defendant Sean A. Maylin not in court.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Sean A. Maylin.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Dolch has no record to make.  State requests warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.  22TR4904 is defaulted.
Return date on October 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Not to go to taverns/bars/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute sobriety at all times. Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  No operation of MV w/o valid DL

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sean A. Maylin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Sean A. Maylin. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for PD appointment.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends a signature bond.  No objection from Atty. Dolch.  $1,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to possess any alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid D/L.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
